body:
> If this missed in the document, could you send a pull request to add this in the document?

Sure, my pleasure.
Truly, we don't know. All PMC are either working on vm or k8s.
This error simply means the backend address is not right. Nothing more.
Ignored should only show up when agent can't connect to backend. Is this your case?

Take an across check with this doc, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/Application-toolkit-logback-1.x.md. If yours is still missing there, update this doc, please.

> Take an across check with this doc, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/Application-toolkit-logback-1.x.md. If yours is still missing there, update this doc, please.

Good, I'll update that tomorrow.
Now only keep ```service_p99``` in ```official_analysis.oal```,  ```TTL ES7``` and ```TTL ES6``` worked well (removing some metrics from oal had the same effect).
@kezhenxu94 @dmsolr @JaredTan95 Please review this PR.

> > Take an across check with this doc, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/Application-toolkit-logback-1.x.md. If yours is still missing there, update this doc, please.
> 
> Good, I'll update that tomorrow.

[https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/4019](pull request for this)

> LGTM. @kezhenxu94 @JaredTan95 @zhaoyuguang Are you familiar with this encoder? If so, please recheck.

I'm not familiar with this area 😕 so no opinion can be given, don't count upon me in this PR 😄

[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/skywalking/pull/4019?src=pr&el=continue).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/skywalking/pull/4019?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [14a81c8...e7fe52c](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/skywalking/pull/4019?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

As what you are doing, we don't expect have trace, topology and metrics across cloud, then why don't you simply use namespace to isolate two env?

> Make sure of the cross-cloud invocation has the same treaceId.

You just sync the metadata across cloud, sharing traceid doesn't change the fact, the trace saved in different Clouds. What is the point of this?

BTW, what do you want the SkyWalking community to take part in? I just read the contents, all are about what you did. I assume what you did, defintely makes sense to you. 
Do you intend to share your change? Or something else?

I think maybe this is a complicated discussion, I will send the detail of my questions to dev@skywalking.apache.org. 
If my current problem is resolved and the implementation is adopted, I would be very happy to be a Contributor of Skywalking!
Welcome to join the mail list. Let's discuss there.
What are you proposing? I am not following.

> suggest write consul cluster nodes .

We are not suggest to write consule node. We are giving configurations example to the users about how to use SkyWalking consul cluster management plugin.
If you want to propose another implementation of cluster management for Consul. You should propose the changes. I and SkyWalking team are very hard to evalue the meaning before this high level doc.

> What are you proposing? I am not following.

I suggest use " the consul agents " to instead 。Can I write this one to push ?

> Can I write this one to push?

I am not following your change. How you deploy the Consul is your choice. The node we talked is the OAP node, it is not Consule node. That is why I mean, I am not following.

> > Can I write this one to push?
> 
> I am not following your change. How you deploy the Consul is your choice. The node we talked is the OAP node, it is not Consule node. That is why I mean, I am not following.

I means this text below:

` # Consul cluster nodes, example: 10.0.0.1:8500,10.0.0.2:8500,10.0.0.3:8500
    hostPort: ${SW_CLUSTER_CONSUL_HOST_PORT:localhost:8500}`

this ' consul cluster nodes.' can replace by 'the consul agents'  .  sorry for My description is not very clear ~~

> this ' consul cluster nodes.' can replace by 'the consul agents' . sorry for My description is not very clear

Is there any difference for codes? Or just name change suggestion?

> > this ' consul cluster nodes.' can replace by 'the consul agents' . sorry for My description is not very clear
> 
> Is there any difference for codes? Or just name change suggestion?

just name change suggestion.
Go for it.

> If I deploy 3 standalone oap nodes or deploy cluster nodes with consul ,what 's the different ?

No, you can't. The analysis is a distributed aggregation. So, the OAP nodes should be aware of other nodes. We don't write these things in the documentations, I don't know any project to introduce this in the document. We said it is a cluster, which should indicate very clearly you should not do this.
Related to #4021

Why tests cancelled? I knew America auther. I will try to invite him to review after we think this PR is ready.

One question, how it works when grpc plugin is there top?

> Why tests cancelled?

I cancelled the tests before I update the commit, to save unnecessary tests.

> I knew America auther. I will try to invite him to review after we think this PR is ready.

Hah, that makes me nervous, I knew him too but this may be too trivial for him 😄 

> 
> One question, how it works when grpc plugin is there top?

This plugin just supports http protocol for now, nothing to do with GRPC

Please don’t sync this. This related PR #3978 is still under reviewing.

I knew there're many break changes between versions 0.x.x, making compatibilities in a single plugin seems impossible (or at least troublesome because some of the APIs completely changed or even removed), that's why I choose to support version under 0.90.x for now, and 0.9x.x should be almost stable and can be supported in another plugin that may be also stable in the (near) future, what do you think @wu-sheng , is 0.90.x becoming stable gradually now? @ikhoon
Oh, I didn't realize it is not 0.8.x only. Then you may need 0.8.x in the maven dependency. But is 0.8.x widely used? What do you think? @ikhoon

You can't, because agent is in sleep mode.
Which part inconsistent?
The order of display on UI，for example, before querying the database, call another link, but when it is displayed on the UI, call the link display, after querying the database

> The order of display on UI，for example, before querying the database, call another link, but when it is displayed on the UI, call the link display, after querying the database

OK. I am not sure. If you have time, we are welcome you to contribute some fix. I think if there is a bug, it most likely a UI level bug.
@boyill Could you provide the GraphQL query result here? It will help to locate the issue.

@wu-sheng The issue is because the UI is not sorted when it is displayed，I modified three files（trace-detail-chart-list.vue、trace-detail-chart-table.vue、trace-detail-chart-tree.vue） and added the order by span's startTime. But I'm not sure if sorting by time will cause new problems, such as time synchronization.

Sort by time is not right, First, you should make sure the segment order is as same as the backend, by considering segment id + span id =0, then spanid and parent spanid relationship, finally if they have same parent span id, and belong to the same segment(same segment id), they should order by start time. Then you would not face time synchronization requirement. Could you follow this to submit a PR?
